messages.messageBody:
-=- I have been here for just about 14 years or so, on and off, but had to take a break from groups as I was spending wayyyyy to much time reading through them.lol. -=-

Where were you reading fourteen years ago?
(This discussion is 10.5 years old, but came out of some others, some defunct. Was it unschooling.com?)

Too much reading can take away from time being with kids, but too little reading can be a problem, too.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: hey guys
messages.msgSnippet: just a sort of wave out. I have been here for just about 14 years or so, on and off,  but had to take a break from groups as I was spending wayyyyy to much
messages.messageBody:
just a sort of wave out. I have been here for just about 14 years or so, on and off, but had to take a break from groups as I was spending wayyyyy to much time reading through them.lol. Anyway I missed reading through them , so now I am back. I am a Sahm Wife and Unschooling Mama of five. Tyler , our oldest is 14 and decided to go to highschool this year and is doing GREAT mark wise, but is realizing that its a big old waste of his time and wants to come back home and "get on with life already" lol He was/is unschooled his entire life, but then went right into advanced level highschool and didnt even bat an eye. AND he talks to other people! < insert eye roll here> anyway, lol, Ashleigh is 12, Heather is 10 , Oliver is 6 and Emily-Rose is 19 months. I look forward to sharing and learning with you all.
Many Blessings
Sarah
